title: Filipino American Mobile DJ Scene
name: Filipino American Mobile DJ Scene
description:
A Map by Legionsofboom

Map of the Filipino American Mobile DJ scene from the late 70s through mid-1990s. 

legionsofboom.com

properties.name: Balboa H.S.
properties.description: Posted by Legionsofboom1000 Cayuga Ave, San Francisco, CABalboa H.S. was home to several of the most influential Filipino mobile crews and DJs, including the very first in the Bay Area: Sound Explosion. Sound Explosion (78 - 80) Electric Sounds (79 - ?) Disco Tech Limited aka D.T.L. (80 - ?) Sounds of Success aka S.O.S. (79/80 - ?) Go-Go\'s (first Pinay crew) (82 - 82) DJ Q-Bert (Live Style Productions) (86 - ?)

properties.name: Benicia Clock Tower
properties.description: Posted by Legionsofboom 1189 Washington Street, Benicia, CA, United StatesThis venue is a historic site in Benicia, a city located in the S.F. Bay area Key party: "It\'s Your Chance to Rock": June 26,1987. Hosted by D-Boyz Productions. Feat.: High Energy Musique Universal Beat of Union City (Fairfield) D.S.C. Starlight Sensation (S.F.) Touch of Class (D.C.)

properties.name: California Hall
properties.description: Posted by Legionsofboom 625 Polk St., San Francisoc, CAVenue site in the late 70s, early 80s (now home to the California Culinary Academy). Key Parties: "Disco Extravaganza": Sound Explosion, December 1, 1979. "Disco Unlimited": Sound Explosion, July 25, 1980. (Hosted by Kevin A. J. Black)

properties.name: Centennial Hall
properties.description: Posted by Legionsofboom22292 Foothill Blvd., Hayward, CA, United StatesKey East Bay venue. A favorite of AA Productions. Key parties: "Summer Showcase III". Hosted by AA Productions. June 19, 1987. Feat: Ultra Mix (D\'Jam Hassan of Bumpin\' Sounds, S.J. and Genie "G" of Ultimate Creations, S.F.) Legion of Boom (Sound Sequence, S.F., Midstar Productions, D.C., Images Inc, Fremont, Creative Madness, U.C.) Starlight Sensations (S.F.) MC Fly Productions (Stockton) Universal Beat (U.C.) High Energy (Fairfield) Style Beyond Compare (S.F.) Knight Sounds (S.J.) Imperial Sounds (San Mateo) Unlimited Sounds (D.C.) Spintronix (D.C.) Turntable Wizards (S.J.) Skyway Sounds (S.J.) Hi Tech (D.C., Sacramento) Nitelife Sensations (S.F.)

properties.name: Holly Community Center
properties.description: Posted by Legionsofboom 31600 Alvarado Blvd., Union City, CA, United StatesThis community center was host to Feat.: D\'Jam Hassan (Bumpin Sounds) Ultimate Creations (S.F.) Sean Tayco and Dave Miguel (DMST, Hayward) The Whiz (Unique Musique)

properties.name: Lincoln H.S.
properties.description: Posted by Legionsofboom162 24th Ave, San Francisco CAKey high school for several crews out in the "Avenues" (Richmond/Sunset district). Ultimate Creations (81 - 88) Unlimited Productions (81 - ?) Mystical Illusions (??)

properties.name: Lion's Blind Center
properties.description: Posted by Legionsofboom 101 North Bascom AvenueThis venue was the site of the one-year anniversary celebration for the Dangerous Image Posse. August 10, 1991. Hosted by the Dangerous Image Posse. Feat.: D.J. Exquisite Sounds Knuckle Neck Tribe (S.F.) Ragga Muppets (D.C.) Stank Winos (D.C.) Dangerous Image (S.J.) Master\'s of Movement (Newark) II of Diamond (Fremont)

properties.name: Newark Pavilion
properties.description: Posted by Legionsofboom 6430 Thornton Ave, Newark, CA 94560A venue in the East Bay. Key parties held here: "Expressions". Hosted by Expressions. November 17, 1990. Feat.: Creative Madness of Legion of Boom Sound Syndicate w/ DJ Exboyza and DJ Audie Spinning Images (D.C.) Ricky Lee (Style Beyond Compare) Joey "J." Rocks (Unlimited Play) Mixing in Action, (S.J.) Dave Meyer ( D.E.F. , San Mateo) Hercules w/ McPaul Cooley (Dynamic Sounds) Mario Elias ( McFly Productions) Jazzy Jim (Skyway Sounds)

properties.name: Sahara Club
properties.description: Posted by Legionsofboom 444 De Haro, San Francisco, CASahara Club was the venue for a "jet-setting" themed mobile dj party. Party Hosted by Agenda and CSUSF\'s Phi Gamma Chi sorority. September 7, 1996. Featured DJs and crews: DJ Apollo; DJ Shortkut (Invisible Skratch Pickles) DJ Chris Palacio (Second to None) DJ Dynamix (3 Style Attractions)

properties.name: St. Augustine Church
properties.description: Posted by Legionsofboom Daly City, CASt. Augustine was a key site for mobile parties, especially through the mid-1980s. Popular among the SF and DC crews. Key parties held there: "49er Fever": Hosted by Unique Musique, January 19, 1985. Other Crews affiliated: Non-Stop Boogie Sound Sequence Infinite Sounds Unique Musique

properties.name: Stephaneum Hall
properties.description: Posted by Legionsofboom 1052 Geary Blvd.This venue was the site of "Erotic City", a battle of the D.J.s party. Hosted by the Balboa High Octagon Club. November 3, 1984. Feat.: Unique Musique Unlimited Sounds

properties.name: The Cathedral Hill Hotel
properties.description: Posted by Legionsofboom 1101 Van Ness Avenue, San Francisco, CA, United States

properties.name: The Galleria
properties.description: Posted by Legionsofboom 101 Henry Adams Street, San Francisco, CA, United StatesThis attractive venue was the site of several of the largest DJ/Showcasing events in the 90s. Parties held here: The popularly known "Galleria Battle". Hosted by Profit Productions. April 5, 1991. "Agenda 96 DJ Showcase". Hosted by the "Bishop of Hip-Hop". June 29, 1996. Feat.: D\'Jam Hassan (Bumpin Sounds) JazzyJim (Skyway Sounds) Q-Bert (Livestyle Productions) Grandmixer T.D.C. (Funk-It-Up Productions) Sonny Abad (3-D Sounds) Ricky Lee (Style Beyond Compare) Genie-G (Ultimate Creations) Chris Palacio (Second to None) Chris the Rebel (Spintronix)

properties.name: The Green Room at the S.F. War Memorial and Performing Arts Center
properties.description: Posted by Legionsofboom 401 Van Ness Avenue, San Francisco, CA, United States This venue was the site of an event where showcasers and breakings crews shared the staged. Key Parties held here: "Let the Music Play" Feat.: Unique Musique Eternal Sound Productions Futuristic Sounds also featuring: Universal Breaking Crew Illusionists Master City Breakers Radio Active Rockers Eternal Breaking Crew

properties.name: The Irish Center
properties.description: Posted by Legionsofboom 2700 45th Avenue, San Francisco, CA, United StatesThis venue was the site of another huge DJ Battle party in the late 80s hosted by the kingmakers of the DJ mobile scene, Imagine Productions. Key parties held here: "Ten Anniversary DJ Battle Royale". Hosted by Imagine Productions. June 17, 1988. Feat.: Nitelime Productions (Fremont) Sound Creations (Vallejo) Style Beyond Compare (D.C.) Divine Style Productions (Hercules) Paulie Paul of Imperial Sounds Sound Innovation (S.F.)

properties.name: Toso Pavilion (now known as Leavey Center), Santa Clara University
properties.description: Posted by Legionsofboom 500 El Camino Real, Santa Clara, CA, United StatesThis venue was the site of a huge DJ competition involving dozens of battling and showcasing DJs from within and around the Bay area. Parties held there: "DJs Extravaganza": May 9, 1992. Hosted by Ryan Hubris and Helen Chau with the Vietnamese (VSA) Student Association at Santa Clara University (SCU). Feat.: Sychronized Sounds and Battling DJs: DJ D\'Styles (Fremont) DJ Quest (S.F.) DJ Smash (Stockton) Positvely Red (S.F.) 3-D/ Sonny Abad (Hercules) Grandmaster TCD (S.J.) with Showcasing DJs: Ladda Sounds (Oakland) High Class (Fairfield) Exquisite Sounds (S.J.) Mixing In Action (Santa Clara) Second to None (D.C.) Mixx Force (Milpitas)
